0.user_question: Each person in a certain household consumes 0.2 kg of rice every meal. Supposing 5 members of the household eat rice every lunch and dinner, how many weeks will a 42 kg bag of rice last?

ost_step.1: Identify the number of servings per week. There are 5 people in the household. So, they consume 0.2 kg of rice per person every meal.
ost_step.2: Identify the number of meals per week. There are 7 days in a week. So, they consume 0.2 kg of rice every meal.
ost_step.3: Identify the number of weeks per year. There are 52 weeks in a year. So, it will last for 3 weeks.

direct_answer.text: Let's think step by step. There are 5 members in the household. They consume 0.2 kg of rice per meal. So, they consume 0.2 kg of rice per day. 5 x 0.2 = 1. So, 1 x 0.2 = 0.2 kg. 1 x 7 = 7. 0.2 x 7 = 1.4 kg. So, 1.4 kg will last for 3 weeks.

0.user_question: Each person in a certain household consumes 0.2 kg of rice every meal. Supposing 5 members of the household eat rice every lunch and dinner, how many weeks will a 42 kg bag of rice last?

direct_answer.text: Let's think step by step. Assuming 5 people eat rice every meal, they consume 0.2 kg per meal. 5 x 0.2 = 1 kg per person per meal. 1 kg x 5 = 5 kg per week. 5 x 5 = 25 kg per month. 25 kg x 4 weeks = 100 kg per month. 100 kg x 5 people = 500 kg per month. 500 kg x 4 weeks = 2000 kg per month. 2000 kg x 5 people = 10000 kg per month. 10000 kg x 4 weeks = 40000 kg per month. 40000 kg x 5 people = 200000 kg per month. So, a 42 kg bag of rice will last 200,000 kg per month.
